BasicDescription.Title: Despatch Box
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Political discussion analysing the day's events in Parliament.

BasicDescription.Title: Unearthing The Woodwide Web
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. Recent discoveries about fungi are unleashing a quiet revolution, they could provide scientists with solutions to economic and environmental problems.

BasicDescription.Title: Blue Sky: Big Bang
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. A look at how star-gazing could help catch criminals.

BasicDescription.Title: Truth Will Out
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. The Natural Limit Of Our Lives: An investigation into the ageing process, and the possibility that in the future, our lifespans could be significantly longer.

BasicDescription.Title: Small Matters
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. A look at how the behaviour of friends on a night out falls under the influence, of chemistry.

BasicDescription.Title: Cell City
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. City Works: Likening the inner workings of cells to a city, a fun yet robust analogy, provides a springboard into cell division and cancer research.

BasicDescription.Title: Object Lessons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. Cigarettes: Fiona Thomas is a 200 cigarette a day woman. Join her and her smoking machine to discover the fascination of fags.

BasicDescription.Title: Food: Whose Choice Is It Anyway?
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. Four short stories about eating illustrate why food choices can't be taken at face value.

BasicDescription.Title: Rocky Shores
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. Life On The Edge: Exploring the rocky coasts of the UK - battle-grounds in which seaweeds and animals compete for their place.

BasicDescription.Title: Rapid Climate Change
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open Science. Three experts visit some of their former research sites, to explain the effects of climate change during the Quaternary period.

BasicDescription.Title: Blast Open Access TV 9
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Curriculum Development. For the first time, the BBC showcases the best of performance, dance and short films made for and by teenagers across Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: Japanese Language And People
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Languages. Introduction to the language, culture and everyday life.

BasicDescription.Title: Working For Yourself
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Money Basics: Evan Davis explains 3 key finance concepts to help survival and prosperity. Financial Forecasting gives advice with planning, while Pricing shows how to ensure the price is right.

BasicDescription.Title: Designer Rides
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Jerk And Jounce: How maths puts the thrill into rollercoaster rides.

BasicDescription.Title: Choices, Choices
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Tourism. Green Living: How the choices we make when going on holiday affect the environment. W/S. Followed by A Passion For Science.

BasicDescription.Title: Energy Through The Window
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Statistically speaking, how practical is it to build a house heated by sunlight?

BasicDescription.Title: Rotten Ralph
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The Ralph Who Cried Wolf: Ralf enjoys being rescued by the fire brigade and makes the most of it - over and over again.

BasicDescription.Title: Smurfs' Adventures
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Soup A La Smurf: Papa Smurf puts something into Bigmouth's soup to disfigure the hungry ogre.

BasicDescription.Title: Woody Woodpecker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Fake Vacation/Medical Winnie Pig/Cable Ace: A triple bill of nutty cartoon adventures featuring Woody Woodpecker and his friends.

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Catch up on the latest developments in the Academy.

BasicDescription.Title: Call The Shots
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Sarah Cawood, Steve Wilson and Fearne Cotton reveal more secrets of the film industry, including how to make it rain on a sunny day and how to breathe life into robots.

BasicDescription.Title: The Wayne Manifesto
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Witch Wayne: It's Halloween and Violet decides to find out the truth about the neighbourhood 'witch'.

BasicDescription.Title: Clifford The Big Red Dog
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. An Itchy Patch: Despite itching like crazy, Clifford does his best not to scratch when he overhears Emily saying that she will have to take him to the vet.

BasicDescription.Title: Romuald The Reindeer
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Migration World: Romuald and his family visit a theme park for reindeers.

BasicDescription.Title: Angelmouse
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Windy Weather Day: There's trouble on cloud nine and Angelmouse has to beat the wind to get there.

BasicDescription.Title: Fimbles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Yellow: Pom finds a yellow circle in the Purple Meadow - it's lovely and warm to play in, and someone is especially happy to see the yellow - find out who it is!

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies Count To Christmas
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. A magic Teletubbies moment in the style of an Advent Calendar on a count down to Christmas Day.

BasicDescription.Title: Pingu
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Building Igloos: Pingu and his friend Hugo decide to build an igloo. They set off to find a suitable location but a violent squabble ensues when they can't agree on a site.

BasicDescription.Title: Tweenies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. We Miss Bella: The Tweenies miss Bella when she is ill, so they make her a get well card.

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Bluebells: Po is walking in Teletubbyland when a bluebell appears. Po shows Laa Laa the bluebell and then, one by one, more bluebells appear. Soon they are everywhere.

BasicDescription.Title: Birthdays
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Will your birthday card be among today's colourful selection?

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Storytime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 4-5] Scruff: The grand unveiling of Diggory, the mechanical dog. Mr Banglebede demonstrates Diggory's usefulness by getting him to carry a fish to the kitchen, but it doesn't go like clockwork.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Numbertime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 5-7] Patterns Of Five: What are Bill and Bernie having for tea? How many things will Little Juan and his friends bring to the school jumble sale? And why have Scrap and Glimmer gone dotty?

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Words And Pictures
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 5-7] Magic Pencil. Teaching children basic handwriting movements and letter formation.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Hands Up!
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Fantastic Mr Fox. Part 2: British Sign Language adaptation of Roald Dahl's well-loved story. The foxes face death from farmers' rifles and starvation, until Mr Fox has a plan. W/S. [Signed]

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: English Express
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Own Goal: Ian manages to get a front page scoop two days in a row when Hussein leads him to the stolen trophy using information that he has obtained by lip-reading.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Zig Zag Shorts
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] France. The Alps-Traditions And Tourism: A look at different ways of life in the French Alps, featuring a sheep-farming family and a family who live and work in a ski resort.

BasicDescription.Title: Working Lunch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Business, consumer and workplace news from the award-winning team who tell it like it is. With Adrian Chiles, Adam Shaw and roving reporter Rob Pittam.

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies Everywhere
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. The Teletubbies watch a film about Korean children looking at large snails in a wood.

BasicDescription.Title: Seniors Tennis
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sue Barker presents live coverage of the opening round-robin matches in this annual Delta Tour Of Champions from the Royal Albert Hall. Featuring no fewer than four Wimbledon champions.

Sue Barker presents live coverage of the opening round-robin matches in this annual Delta Tour Of Champions from the Royal Albert Hall.
No fewer than four Wimbledon champions will be on display in a tournament featuring some of the true greats of tennis, from BBC quiz master, John McEnroe, to Australia's crowd favourite, Pat Cash. Fierce German rivals Boris Becker and Michael Stich are best remembered in Britain for their duel in the 1991 Wimbledon final and could face each other again here. Also in the line-up will be former British number one, Jeremy Bates.
With commentary from John Lloyd and Andrew Castle.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC. Followed by regional news and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Animal Park
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble explore life behind the scenes at Longleat Safari Park. It's time for the camels to have a haircut.

BasicDescription.Title: Ready Steady Cook
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Take a couple of chefs, add two contestants, throw in some ingredients and garnish liberally with Ainsley Harriott. Simmer and enjoy.

BasicDescription.Title: The Weakest Link
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Another panel of contestants battle each other and the acid tongue of Anne Robinson to build up the �10,000 prize fund and walk away with the lot.

BasicDescription.Title: The Simpsons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Raging ABE Simpson And His Grumbling Grandson: Grampa and Mr Burns, the last surviving members of a Second World War army unit, battle for a priceless collection of art hidden in a secret location.

BasicDescription.Title: Fresh Prince Of Bel Air
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Hex And The Single Guy: The Banks family attend a seance and Will invokes the wrath of the spiritualist with his sceptical behaviour.

BasicDescription.Title: Robot Wars: The Sixth Wars
BasicDescription.Synopsis: As well as the usual carnage in the arena, this series sees the robots facing the peril of falling pianos and washing machines in the all new Drop Zone. It's bigger and badder than ever!
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Multimedia: Robot Wars - Extreme Destruction (Xbox)

BasicDescription.Title: Rough Science
BasicDescription.Synopsis: It's D-day for the team as they face the final challenge of smelting the precious gold that they've collected over their six-week stay in New Zealand.

BasicDescription.Title: Hidden Gardens
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Lyveden: Chris Beardshaw uncovers the mysteries of Lyveden in Northamptonshire, with its stunning garden lodge and surrounding moats, orchards and snail mounts.

BasicDescription.Title: Gardeners' World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Character Gardens: Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame look back at some of the most enjoyable films in the last series of Gardeners' World, and at some of the most inspirational amateur gardeners.

BasicDescription.Title: Building The Impossible
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Roman War Machine: The most devastating weapon in the armoury of the Romans was a huge torsion-spring catapult, standing over eight metres high. Can the team recreate one in just two weeks?

The Roman War Machine
The most terrifying weapon in the Romans' armoury was a huge torsion-spring catapult. They used it to devastating effect at the Siege of Jerusalem in AD 70. It stood over eight metres high and to this day no-one has ever succeeded in recreating one of these monsters - but this is the task facing Professor Chris Wise and Dr. Caroline Baillie and their chosen team. Once they have come up with a design they will have just two weeks to build it from scratch. Will they do it in the time and get it to fire?

BasicDescription.Title: Ray Mears' Country Tracks
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Ray goes beachcombing and sources a tasty meal from edible seaweed, and Lindsay Cannon explores crannogs - habitations constructed on small natural or man-made islands.

BasicDescription.Title: Porridge
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A Day Out: When Fletcher and Godber are allowed out in a work gang, Mr Barrowclough gets more than he bargained for.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsnight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In-depth investigation and analysis of the stories behind the day's headlines.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsnight Review
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Newsnight reviews the latest releases in the arts.

BasicDescription.Title: Later With Jools Holland
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A star-packed lineup join Jools for the last in the series, with Coldplay, Foo Fighters, 1 Giant Leap, Robbie Williams and Baaba Maal in the studio. W/S. Strong language.
